main.name: Tuan Pham
main.bio: I have serious passion for computer programming and love using it to solve problems around me. I enjoy using my obsessive attention to detail to bring ideas to life. That's why I'm excited to make a big impact at a high growth company.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

works.title: Full Stack Developer - remote
works.description:
Test and fine-tune the application, reducing the instances of bugs by 20%. 
 Develop automation solution using C# to increase process efficiency of the design team.
Contribute to 10+ new app features along with their APIs.
Create & manage buckets on S3 and store DB and logs backup.
Use AWS Lambda, DynamoDB, CloudWatch, S3, and Athena services to create reliable ranking and reward systems.
Involve in Architecture Modification to significantly reduce the burden onthe server.

works.title: Unity Developer Intern
works.description:
Maintained and enhanced existing functionality, including debugging and fixing bugs.
Collaborated with other graphic artists to develop new features of the app.
Analyzed and quickly resolved tool issues in order to meet deadlines for app goals.

content.description: Gridtalk is a mini social media platform that can bring people together with it's GridRoom by using one of it's two features such as direct messaging or live chat room.
I was leading a team of 3 developers, designed and developed the restaurant management system using Visual Basic and Microsoft Access.

Inspired from Yinguobing/cnn-facial-landmark's Github repository, I developed and trained a convolutional neural network model with a dataset of 10,000+ images to detect 68 facial key points on a human face in real-time.

I was leading a team as a SCRUM master to create a fortune-telling Tarot card game. I designed the entire gameplays and 5 user stories which were implemented in 5 sprints (15 weeks). I was also a developer who wrote the code to create all card animations including shuffling, spreading, and flipping as well as many core functionalities in the game.

In this game, I created a patrol system that AI bots is getting smarter through each difficulty level to chase and attack the player. If there is no player in range, the AI bots will be destroying all the alive plants around. If the player is killed by the AI bots or cannot heal 10 plants until all of them are dead, the game is over.

This is an endless runner 2D game that a player just needs to jump to pass many obstacles as possible. I developed a bot with a regression function to automatically play the game. The independent variable of the function is the obstacle’s heights and the dependent variable is the correct distance to jump between the player and the upcoming obstacles.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Sonny Sangha must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
